# Digits of Pi (π)
A Swift-based calculator for the digits of Pi (π), currently hardlimited to a maximum of 10,000 — 
although this can be easily changed in the storyboard slider limits.  This demo uses a Machin-based Pi
calculation, except that it uses the `Integer` package's infinite-sized integers to get as many 
digits as we want.  It still computes the formula: pi = 4 * (4 * arccot(5) - arccot(239)).

The user interface is very simple with a slider to control the number of pi digits.  Calculations are
performed in a background task so the slider motion is not affected during the calculations.

Here it is:

![Pi App](App.png)

The first 10,000 digits (spoiler alert) are:

